style_guide: Clear structure with step-by-step explanations, conversational tone, minimal technical jargon with clear explanations when used, and highlighted key points

sections.section_title: Basic Understanding of Moment of Inertia
learning_goals: Understand what moment of inertia is
Learn why it's important in rotational motion

content_points.content_summary: Explain moment of inertia as a measure of rotational inertia that determines how difficult it is to change an object's rotation

sources.key_quote: The moment of inertia is defined as the quantity expressed by the body resisting angular acceleration, which is the sum of the product of the mass of every particle with its square of the distance from the axis of rotation.

content_points.content_summary: Present the general formula I = mr² and explain its components

sources.key_quote: In general form, moment of inertia is expressed as I = m × r²

learning_goals: Understand what affects an object's moment of inertia
Learn how mass distribution impacts rotational motion

content_points.content_summary: Explain how density, shape, size, and axis of rotation affect moment of inertia

sources.key_quote: The moment of inertia depends on the following factors: The density of the material, Shape and size of the body, Axis of rotation (distribution of mass relative to the axis)

learning_goals: Understand real-world applications of moment of inertia

content_points.content_summary: Explain applications in machinery and everyday life

sources.key_quote: The moment of inertia of a rotating flywheel is used in a machine to resist variations in applied torque to smooth its rotational output.
